definition: (in former times) to escort the emperor (or other important personage)/(nowadays) to escort sb (usually jocular)
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
surname Jia
to harness/to draw (a cart etc)/to drive/to pilot/to sail/to ride/your good self/prefixed word denoting respect (polite 敬辞)
(idiom) to safeguard (sth)/to protect (sth)

sentences.english: A hundred knights and a thousand soldiers escorted the Princess Helena.
sentences.chinese: 一百名骑士和一千名士兵为海伦纳公主保驾。

sentences.english: Teachers to do a guide, students can learn self-protect.
sentences.chinese: 教师要做一个领路人，为学生的自能学习保驾护航。

sentences.english: Too big a risk, even with Mr. Eastwood at the wheel.
sentences.chinese: 纵使有伊斯特伍德保驾护航，冒的险也忒大了吧。

sentences.english: Ghosts of Lost Souls at Sea to be Shepherded Through the Watery Passageway.
sentences.chinese: 海上死难者的灵魂将乘着水路被保驾护航。

sentences.english: Select Jinxing Central Asia, to protect you, the user first choice.
sentences.chinese: 选择金兴中亚，为您保驾护航，用户第一首选。

sentences.english: In short courageous love is the love of weapons escort.
sentences.chinese: 总之勇敢就是爱情的武器为爱情保驾护航。

sentences.english: Wish Jin Shengyuan science and technology escorts the Emperor for your career progress convoy.
sentences.chinese: 愿金圣元科技为您事业发展保驾护航。

sentences.english: They arrive on foreign shores with the security of a job and a salary.
sentences.chinese: 为他们踏上异国领土保驾护航的是稳定的工作和薪水。

sentences.english: The construction of new socialist countryside needs to be escorted and convoyed by law.
sentences.chinese: 社会主义新农村建设，需要法治保驾护航。

sentences.english: OBJECTIVE To develop a method for the determination the ursolic acid in Baojia capsules.
sentences.chinese: 目的建立测定保驾胶囊中熊果酸含量的方法。

definition: to guard/to protect
to clear the way
not to be worried about/all taken care of
to seek to protect/to ensure/to maintain/to guard
to spare no effort (idiom); to do one's utmost
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)
to open up a path/to make one's way through/to construct a road/(electricity) open circuit
to share tribulations/to help sb with worries and difficulties
(honorific) your kind efforts/thanks to your help
heavy responsibility/serious criticism
to bring up the rear/to provide support/to hold the lines
pioneer/trailbreaker
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
on imperial orders
to assist (usually a ruler)
to risk one's life
